001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.regimes;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Proxy;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Strategy;
005import net.tvburger.jdl.model.DataSet;
006import net.tvburger.jdl.model.EstimationFunction;
007import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.ObjectiveFunction;
008import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.Optimizer;
009import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.Regime;
010
011import java.util.ArrayList;
012import java.util.Iterator;
013import java.util.List;
014import java.util.Optional;
015import java.util.function.Predicate;
016
017/**
018 * Composes and executes a chain of {@link Regime} decorators.
019 *
020 * <p>The chain stores regimes in order and, when trained, delegates to the
021 * <em>top</em> (last) regime. If the chain is empty, this class will invoke
022 * the provided {@link Optimizer} directly on the full {@link DataSet} as a
023 * single batch (a safe no-op fallback if the caller omitted regimes).</p>
024 *
025 * <h3>Semantics</h3>
026 * <ul>
027 *   <li><strong>Top regime:</strong> the last element in {@code chainedRegimes} receives
028 *       the {@link #train} call and typically wraps the rest.</li>
029 *   <li><strong>Lookup:</strong> {@link #getRegime(Class)} and {@link #findRegime(java.util.function.Predicate)}
030 *       return the first matching regime for introspection or reconfiguration.</li>
031 *   <li><strong>Iteration:</strong> Implements {@link Iterable} to expose the chain order (top to bottom).</li>
032 * </ul>
033 */
034@Strategy(Strategy.Role.CONCRETE)
035public class ChainedRegime implements Regime, Iterable<Regime> {
036
037    /**
038     * The ordered chain of regimes; the last element is the top/outermost decorator.
039     */
040    protected final List<Regime> chainedRegimes;
041
042    /**
043     * Creates a new chain.
044     *
045     * @param chainedRegimes ordered regimes; the last is considered the "top".
046     *                       May be empty; in that case {@link #train} falls back
047     *                       to direct optimizer invocation if provided.
048     */
049    protected ChainedRegime(List<Regime> chainedRegimes) {
050        this.chainedRegimes = chainedRegimes;
051    }
052
053    /**
054     * Trains by delegating to the topmost regime in the chain. If the chain is empty,
055     * invokes the {@link Optimizer} directly (if non-null) on the full dataset.
056     *
057     * @param estimationFunction the model to train
058     * @param trainingSet        the dataset to train on
059     * @param objective          the objective (loss) function
060     * @param optimizer          the optimizer to apply updates (used directly if chain is empty)
061     * @param <E>                the type of estimation function
062     */
063    @Override
064    public <E extends EstimationFunction> void train(E estimationFunction, DataSet trainingSet, ObjectiveFunction objective, Optimizer<? super E> optimizer) {
065        if (chainedRegimes.isEmpty()) {
066            if (optimizer != null) {
067                optimizer.optimize(estimationFunction, trainingSet, objective);
068            }
069        } else {
070            chainedRegimes.getLast().train(estimationFunction, trainingSet, objective, optimizer);
071        }
072    }
073
074    /**
075     * Returns an iterator over the regimes in from top to bottom.
076     */
077    @Override
078    public Iterator<Regime> iterator() {
079        return chainedRegimes.reversed().iterator();
080    }
081
082    /**
083     * Returns the first regime assignable to {@code regimeTypeClass}, or throws if none.
084     *
085     * @param regimeTypeClass the desired regime type
086     * @param <R>             type parameter of the regime
087     * @return the first matching regime
088     * @throws java.util.NoSuchElementException if none found
089     */
090    public <R extends Regime> R asRegime(Class<R> regimeTypeClass) {
091        return getRegime(regimeTypeClass).orElseThrow();
092    }
093
094    /**
095     * Returns the first regime assignable to the requested type, if any.
096     *
097     * @param regimeTypeClass the desired regime type
098     * @param <R>             type parameter of the regime
099     * @return an {@link Optional} containing the first match, or empty
100     */
101    public <R extends Regime> Optional<R> getRegime(Class<R> regimeTypeClass) {
102        for (Regime regime : chainedRegimes) {
103            if (regimeTypeClass.isInstance(regime)) {
104                return Optional.of(regimeTypeClass.cast(regime));
105            }
106        }
107        return Optional.empty();
108    }
109
110    /**
111     * Returns the first regime matching the predicate, if any.
112     *
113     * @param predicate match condition
114     * @return an {@link Optional} containing the first match, or empty
115     */
116    public Optional<Regime> findRegime(Predicate<? super Regime> predicate) {
117        for (Regime regime : chainedRegimes) {
118            if (predicate.test(regime)) return Optional.of(regime);
119        }
120        return Optional.empty();
121    }
122
123    /**
124     * {@inheritDoc}
125     */
126    @Override
127    public String toString() {
128        return "ChainedRegime" + chainedRegimes;
129    }
130
131    /**
132     * A lightweight link that forwards {@link Regime#train} to another regime in the chain
133     * by index (supports negative indexes counted from the end).
134     *
135     * <p>Used internally by builders to target the current top or relative positions
136     * while the chain is being assembled.</p>
137     *
138     * @param chainedRegimes    Reference to the chained regimes
139     * @param linkedRegimeIndex The target index; negative values are relative to the end.
140     */
141    @Proxy
142    private record Link(List<Regime> chainedRegimes, int linkedRegimeIndex) implements Regime {
143
144        /**
145         * Resolves the linked regime by index (handling negative indexes).
146         *
147         * @return the target regime or {@code null} if out of bounds
148         */
149        private Regime getLinkedRegime() {
150            int index = linkedRegimeIndex < 0 ? chainedRegimes.size() + linkedRegimeIndex : linkedRegimeIndex;
151            return index < chainedRegimes.size() && index >= 0
152                    ? chainedRegimes.get(index)
153                    : null;
154        }
155
156        /**
157         * Forwards training to the linked regime if available; otherwise falls back
158         * to direct optimizer invocation (if non-null).
159         */
160        @Override
161        public <E extends EstimationFunction> void train(E estimationFunction, DataSet trainingSet, ObjectiveFunction objective, Optimizer<? super E> optimizer) {
162            Regime linkedRegime = getLinkedRegime();
163            if (linkedRegime != null) {
164                linkedRegime.train(estimationFunction, trainingSet, objective, optimizer);
165            } else {
166                if (optimizer != null) {
167                    optimizer.optimize(estimationFunction, trainingSet, objective);
168                }
169            }
170        }
171    }
172
173    /**
174     * Builder for constructing instances of {@link ChainedRegime}.
175     * <p>
176     * A chained regime allows multiple {@link Regime} strategies to be
177     * combined and executed in sequence. The {@code Builder} provides
178     * a fluent API to assemble the chain and produce an immutable
179     * {@code ChainedRegime} instance.
180     * </p>
181     */
182    @net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Builder
183    public static class Builder {
184
185        private final List<Regime> chainedRegimes = new ArrayList<>();
186        private Regime targetRegime = nextLink();
187
188        private Link nextLink() {
189            return new Link(chainedRegimes, -2 - chainedRegimes.size());
190        }
191
192        /**
193         * Adds the given regime to the chain and updates {@link #targetRegime}.
194         *
195         * @param regime the regime to add
196         * @return {@code this} builder
197         */
198        private Builder chainRegime(Regime regime) {
199            chainedRegimes.addFirst(regime);
200            targetRegime = nextLink();
201            return this;
202        }
203
204        /**
205         * Adds a {@link BatchRegime} decorator around the current target.
206         *
207         * @return this builder (for fluent chaining)
208         * @see BatchRegime
209         */
210        public final ChainedRegime batch() {
211            return chainRegime(new BatchRegime()).build();
212        }
213
214        /**
215         * Adds an {@link OnlineRegime} decorator around the current target.
216         *
217         * @return this builder (for fluent chaining)
218         * @see OnlineRegime
219         */
220        public final ChainedRegime online() {
221            return chainRegime(new OnlineRegime()).build();
222        }
223
224        /**
225         * Adds a {@link MiniBatchRegime} decorator with a default batch size of 32.
226         *
227         * @return this builder (for fluent chaining)
228         * @see MiniBatchRegime
229         */
230        public final ChainedRegime miniBatch() {
231            return miniBatch(32);
232        }
233
234        /**
235         * Adds a {@link MiniBatchRegime} decorator with the given batch size.
236         *
237         * @param batchSize the number of samples per mini-batch (must be > 0)
238         * @return this builder (for fluent chaining)
239         * @see MiniBatchRegime
240         */
241        public final ChainedRegime miniBatch(int batchSize) {
242            return chainRegime(new MiniBatchRegime(batchSize)).build();
243        }
244
245        /**
246         * Adds an {@link EpochRegime} decorator with a default of 1,000 epochs.
247         *
248         * @return this builder (for fluent chaining)
249         * @see EpochRegime
250         */
251        public final Builder epochs() {
252            return epochs(1_000);
253        }
254
255        /**
256         * Adds an {@link EpochRegime} decorator with the given number of epochs.
257         *
258         * @param epochs the number of epochs to run (must be >= 1)
259         * @return this builder (for fluent chaining)
260         * @see EpochRegime
261         */
262        public final Builder epochs(int epochs) {
263            return chainRegime(new EpochRegime(targetRegime, epochs));
264        }
265
266        /**
267         * Adds an {@link ObjectiveReportingRegime} decorator that reports
268         * objective (loss) values with dumping enabled.
269         *
270         * @return this builder (for fluent chaining)
271         * @see ObjectiveReportingRegime
272         */
273        public final Builder reportObjective() {
274            return chainRegime(new ObjectiveReportingRegime(targetRegime, true));
275        }
276
277        /**
278         * Adds a {@link DumpNodesRegime} decorator with default options (dump after training).
279         *
280         * @return this builder (for fluent chaining)
281         * @see DumpNodesRegime
282         */
283        public final Builder dumpNodes() {
284            return dumpNodes(false);
285        }
286
287        /**
288         * Adds a {@link DumpNodesRegime} decorator with an initial dump toggle.
289         *
290         * @param firstTime whether to dump before the first training step
291         * @return this builder (for fluent chaining)
292         * @see DumpNodesRegime
293         */
294        public final Builder dumpNodes(boolean firstTime) {
295            return dumpNodes(firstTime, false);
296        }
297
298        /**
299         * Adds a {@link DumpNodesRegime} decorator with full configuration.
300         *
301         * @param firstTime     whether to dump before the first training step
302         * @param includeInputs whether to include input nodes in the dump
303         * @return this builder (for fluent chaining)
304         * @see DumpNodesRegime
305         */
306        public final Builder dumpNodes(boolean firstTime, boolean includeInputs) {
307            return chainRegime(new DumpNodesRegime(targetRegime, firstTime, includeInputs));
308        }
309
310        /**
311         * Finalizes the builder and creates an immutable {@link ChainedRegime}.
312         *
313         * <p>The returned {@link ChainedRegime} contains the current list of
314         * decorators in the order they were added. The underlying list is wrapped
315         * with {@link List#copyOf(java.util.Collection)} to ensure immutability,
316         * so further modifications to this builder will not affect the built chain.</p>
317         *
318         * @return an immutable {@link ChainedRegime} representing the current builder state
319         * @see ChainedRegime
320         */
321        protected final ChainedRegime build() {
322            List<Regime> copyChainedRegimes = new ArrayList<>(chainedRegimes);
323            for (Regime regime : chainedRegimes) {
324                if (regime instanceof Link link) {
325                    copyChainedRegimes.add(new Link(copyChainedRegimes, link.linkedRegimeIndex));
326                } else {
327                    copyChainedRegimes.add(regime);
328                }
329            }
330            return new ChainedRegime(copyChainedRegimes);
331        }
332    }
333
334}
